object.name: ActuatorSettings
object.description: Settings for the @ref ActuatorModule that controls the channel assignments for the mixer based on AircraftType

field.name: TimerUpdateFreq
field.description: The frequency of the PWM signal output to the actuator. 0 specifies synchronous PWM.

field.name: ChannelMax
field.description: Maximum output pulse length. Actuator commands will be scaled [-1,1] > [ChannelMin,ChannelMax].

field.name: ChannelNeutral
field.description: Neutral output pulse length. For motors, should be set to the minimum pulse that causes the motor to start and spin reliably. For 3D motors, should be the pulse length that results in no spinning.

field.name: ChannelMin
field.description: Minimum output pulse length. Actuator commands will be scaled from [-1,1] to [ChannelMin,ChannelMax]. For normal motors, should be a value that results in no spinning. For 3D motors, should be the pulse length that result in maximum reverse spin.

field.name: ChannelDeadband
field.description: If nonzero, indicates that this is a 3D motor. For non-dshot modes, indicates the total width of the region around ChannelNeutral. E.g. if ChannelNeutral is 186, and deadband is 10-- 186us will be sent to not spin, 191us to slowly spin forward, and 181us to slowly spin reverse. For dshot modes, if this is 1, the motor is 3D. If it is 2, it is reverse-3D.

field.name: MotorsSpinWhileArmed
field.description: When enabled, the motors will spin at the ChannelNeutral command when armed with zero throttle.

field.name: LowPowerStabilizationMaxPowerAdd
field.description: Maximum power to add to ensure stabilization at low power. Always select a value well under hover power.

field.name: MotorInputOutputCurveFit
field.description: Actuator mapping of input in [-1,1] to output on [-1,1], using power equation of type x^value. This is intended to correct for the non-linear relationship between input command and output power inherent in brushless ESC/motor combinations. A setting below 1.0 will improve high-throttle control stability.
